mav_sim.state_plotter.plotter module¶

Classes and methods for plotting the state data

class mav_sim.state_plotter.plotter.Plotter(plotting_frequency: int = 1, time_window: float = 15, window_title: str = 'States')¶

Bases: object

Class for plotting methods.

add_measurement(state_name: str, state_val: float, time: float, sigma: float = 0.0) → None¶

Adds a measurement for the given state

state_name (string): name of the state state_val (float): value to be added for the state time (float): time (in seconds) of the measurement

add_plotbox(plotbox_args: str | PlotboxArgs) → None¶

Adds a state and the necessary plot, curves, and data lists

curve_names: name(s) of the state(s) to be plotted in the same plot window

(e.g. [‘x’, ‘x_truth’] or [‘x’, ‘x_command’])

add_plotboxes(plotbox_arg_list: list[list[PlotboxArgs] | list[str]] | list[list[PlotboxArgs]] | list[PlotboxArgs] | list[str]) → None¶

Add multiple plotboxes, configured according to the structure of plotbox_arg_list

Parameters:

plotbox_arg_list (list of PlotboxArgs objects or strings) –

contains the arguments for each plotbox to be added. If the list is two-dimensional, the plotboxes will be added according to the list structure:

Example

[[‘x’, ‘y’], would produce a plot with x and y on

[‘u’, ‘v’, ‘w’], –> the first row, u, v, and w on the 2nd, [‘phi’]] and phi on the 3rd.

add_vector_measurement(vector_name: str, vector_values: list[float], time: float, sigma_values: list[float] | None = None) → None¶

Adds a group of measurements in vector form

vector_name (string): name given the vector through the define_input_vector

function

vector_values (list of numbers): values for each of the states in the

order defined in the define_input_vector function

time: time stamp for the values in the vector

add_window(window_title: str) → None¶

Needs to be documented - Appears to add a window

define_input_vector(vector_name: str, input_vector: list[str]) → None¶

Defines an input vector so measurements can be added in groups

vector_name (string): name of the vector input_vector (list of strings): order of states in the vector

Note: this does not add states or plots, so plots for the values in input_vector will need to also be added via the add_plot function

reset_data(start_time: float) → None¶

Resets all data to zero with time given as start_time

set_data(state_name: str, state_vals: list[float], times: int | float | list[int] | list[float], sigmas: list[float] | None = None) → None¶

Sets the data

set_grids(x_grid_on: bool, y_grid_on: bool) → None¶

Determines whether or not to display the grid

set_plots_per_row(n: int) → None¶

Sets the number of plots per row

update_plots() → None¶

Update the plots (according to plotting frequency defined in init)

use_light_theme() → None¶

Needs to be documented

mav_sim.state_plotter.plotter.define_plot_arg_parser() → ArgumentParser¶

Creates a parser to create arg parameters from a string
